content: pumpkin august 2023 1 5 tall 2 5 wide nicole ball abbreviations bl back loop chain chain round s round s single_crochet single_crochet st s stitch es slip_stitch slip_stitch increase single_crochet 2 in stitch decrease single_crochet 2 together yo yarn over materials size 3 00mm crochet hook tapestry needle polyester stuffing locking stitch markers for counting rounds optional yarn this pattern can be used with any weight yarn i usually go down 2 or 3 crochet hook sizes from what is listed on the yarn band for a larger animal try a bulky weight yarn just remember that you will use more yardage than recommended the sample is crocheted in dk weight yarn and all yardage and hook recommendations are calculated based on the sample to complete the pattern you ll need mc orange plymouth yarn dreambaby dk in tomato #153 30 yards a few yards of brown yarn for stem ©2020 texasstitchchicks this pattern is not available for commercial release this means you may not copy and sell or digitally distribute the pattern you may however sell items you make with the pattern helpful instructions and pattern notes gauge this pattern doesn t specify a gauge just make sure when you crochet that the stuffing doesn t show through and the fabric isn t too loose if the stuffing does show through then you ll want to use a smaller hook crochet through back loop all stitches in this pattern are crocheted through the back loop i like to do this because - it looks cute - it s super easy to count rounds - it creates a loop on the outside of the piece that you can use to attach pieces continuous rounds this pattern is created by crocheting in continuous rounds so there is no need to end a round when you complete it because of this it may be easier to count rounds by adding a locking stitch marker to the last stitch of the round ©2020 texasstitchchicks this pattern is not available for commercial release this means you may not copy and sell or digitally distribute the pattern you may however sell items you make with the pattern sloppy slip knot i use the sloppy slip knot to start all the pieces here s how to do it a wrap the yarn around the hook with the tail in the front towards the hook end b yarn over c pull up a loop and crochet as directed when you have completed the first round d pull on the tail to close the hole a b c d as an alternative you can do a magic_ring ©2020 texasstitchchicks this pattern is not available for commercial release this means you may not copy and sell or digitally distribute the pattern you may however sell items you make with the pattern fasten_off with long tail when you fasten_off leave extra yarn 6-12 inches this end can be used to attach pieces by threading the end of the yarn
